column4: I thought we just got finished saying there was no viruses for Linux so why have clamav ?
for the sake of friends running windows, you wouldn't want to accidentally forward them a virus. and ^^what he said
it's a learning filter, you have to tell it what is junk to start with
and the password you set in debconf when you installed?
I have done the dpkg reconfigure via terminal and even did a reinstall via Synaptic either way I get no option to reset the password
after the purge check that /var/lib/mysql is empty
there are ways of resetting the password without reinstalling, but as you've not used it yet this is easier
rm commands with *s in them aren't sensible
there are a few. phpmyadmin is one, or mysql-admin
phpmyadmin is wab-based, mysql-admin is a regular program
that notification went off and scared me to death
